caption: A magnificent medieval church in the Marais district — Notre-Dame des Blancs Manteaux. The name comes from the Servite monks who wore white mantles and founded the first church here in 1258. The church was rebuilt in the French classical style between 1685 and 1690. Inside, you can find a beautifully carved wooden pulpit from 1749 and a collection of paintings and sculptures. During the European Heritage Days, we were allowed to visit the organist’s workplace, where he explained the organ’s structure and shared insights about playing this impressive instrument.

In between two beautiful streets in the Marais, is this little (not so little) gem of a gothic church!  The OG church was built in 1258 but it was rebuilt in the 1600s.  I love the carved wood pulpit which is a work of art!  Mostly on a hot day walking the Marias, it is a cool respite of calm!  On a cold day, it is an oasis of spirituality!

Nice enough church in Le Marais that you'll encounter on your walk from Le Châtelet to La Place des Vosges. Usually the entrance to churches and cathedrals in France is free (unlike in Spain and some other countries) so just get in and enjoy its peace. Inside it is beautiful.

Gothic church with bland dome and beautiful interiors. What a holly place and wonderful experience to see the church choir when they are rehearsing for performances. Sound so good! Located in the le Marais neighborhood and near to the Musee Picasso.

While walking home from a stroll along the River Seine and the Rue de Rivoli busy street I decided to walk along some streets I had not travelled upon and I saw a narrow street which ended with a church.. I walked along Rue Aubriot which ended at this beautiful church.. well worth the detour...
Lovely church in the heart of Marais Village free entrance
Simple and beautiful in the heart of Marais.
It's a very beautiful church
Very pretty. Not always open so I visited during the Journées de la Patrimoine.
Perfect place to visit!!! Unique view, easier to go with the teleferique!!!
It is hidden by buildings. Good place to rest a litte.
Lovely church
Highly recommended.
Nice church

Discovering the Notre Dame des Blancs Manteaux church in Paris was an unforgettable experience, accentuated by the magic of a concert within its walls. Nestled in the heart of the Marais, this church proves to be a haven of peace and beauty, far from the hustle and bustle of Paris. Its discreet facade hides an interior imbued with spirituality and history, where each stone seems to tell a part of the capital's past. Attending a concert in this building was a moment of pure grace, where the music seemed to rise and blend perfectly with the solemn and sacred atmosphere of the place. This church is not only a historical monument; it is a living place, which welcomes and enchants those who are lucky enough to discover its hidden treasures. Its ability to unite art, culture and spirituality makes it a unique jewel of Paris, an experience that is both intimate and universal.
There was a bazaar going on with sales of all kinds of things, it was cool to visit! the church is beautiful
This beautiful church provides a place of tranquility in this bustling neighborhood.

Magnificent church. Thank you very much to Mr. Yves Clair who made us experience the history of this church, thank you for your welcome and your availability. We will not forget this wonderful moment of sharing.

Very strange that it was only after our fifth visit to Paris that we came to know this church, given its historical value. The first building dates back to 1258, undergoing a radical renovation in the 17th century and, after the famous Notre Dame Cathedral, it is the oldest church in Paris dedicated to the Holy Virgin. It was taken during the French Revolution and sold as national property. Repurchased by the city of Paris, it was returned to worship in 1801.

Very cute little Parisian church with charming austerity and integrated into the neighborhood in a very beautiful way since on its side we find the charming Langlois park, very popular with young parents. I quite like the clarity that we can find inside the building with this magnificent light coming through which gives the place a quite unique personality while allowing us to admire the work of the stained glass windows. There are beautiful works there, notably a series dedicated to the Blessed Virgin, ranging from paintings to statues. The first church having been erected by the servants of the Holy Virgin (whose color of clothing gave the name to the Church and to the rue des Blancs Manteaux) it is not surprising to see this theme preserved in a chapel dedicated to her. A small, lively Church in a neighborhood that is just as lively.
Very beautiful church. Large and pleasant. Numerous events organized including concerts and recitals of sacred music. Beautiful, quiet and relaxing place in this very lively area.

Beautiful neighborhood church  I got there by chance following a downpour  The condition of the building is correct, the decoration in its original state  I invite you to find and admire the heritage-listed staircase!  It is still apparent to find yourself in this place to take a break and reconnect with yourself, whatever your religion, moreover,  In short, if you are in the area, take 5 minutes to visit this church
It is a beautiful and large church in the heart of a popular neighborhood. Calm, clear with lots of beautiful details…
All the churches are beautiful in Paris. There are so many to visit. Especially this one. A haven of peace and serenity.
It is a superb church which is very pleasant and quiet in a very lively area.
Very warm welcome and respectful of the "grievances" of a homeless person before my eyes.
On the occasion of the White Night, for the second time, I was able to spend time in this charming and welcoming building.
Stunning ! And very good concert. (Mozart's Requiem)
After the tumult of a Saturday afternoon in the Marais I rested while admiring the choir
Very calming Beautiful side chapel Very good acoustics for concerts
I enjoyed finding this church on Sunday for a Baroque Music concert with Pergolese and also more popular Baroque. A beautiful ensemble with a friend who invited me.
A beautiful little church in the Marais district

Very beautiful church, a renovation project is planned but you need the necessary funds to finance it so if you want to become a patron, now is the time to contribute to the conservation of French heritage.
Having heard and experienced a mass of St Hubert in this beautiful church is a wonderful moment!... and especially to hear the crew of Trumpet Blowers as well as the organ!...
Very good acoustics for a choir-orchestra concert, large enough without being immense, and a good welcome from the parish. And the neighborhood is very lively.

A somewhat hidden parish... I entered it during my walk and had the pleasant surprise of attending an organ concert with a choir of young people for a recital of the Passion according to Saint John by Johann Sebastian Bach. The church itself is quite simple with some very beautiful works of art and is worth a detour for enthusiasts.
A very discreet late 17th century church in the Marais. With a magnificent glass roof and a beautiful dome. I liked the tranquility that reigns there.  Very beautiful church to visit.
A very beautiful church. Sometimes concerts.
